acm.graphics

Class GLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • acm.graphics.GLine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GScalable, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class GLine
extends GObject
implements GScalable
    The GLine class is a graphical object whose appearance consists of a line segment.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double LINE_TOLERANCE
      This constant defines how close (measured in pixel units) a point has to be to a line before that point is considered to be "contained" within the line.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GLine()
      Constructs a line segment of length 0 at position (0, 0).
      GLine(double x0, double y0)
      Constructs a line segment of length 0 at position (x0, y0).
      GLine(double x0, double y0, double x1, double y1)
      Constructs a line segment from its endpoints.

      Returns the bounding box for this object.

      Returns the coordinates of the initial point in the line.

      Returns whether the given x/y point intersects the line from x0,y0 to x1,y1 of the given width.

      Implements the paint2d operation for this graphical object.

    • Field Detail

      • LINE_TOLERANCE

        public static final double LINE_TOLERANCE
        This constant defines how close (measured in pixel units) a point has to be to a line before that point is considered to be "contained" within the line.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • GLine

        public GLine()
        Constructs a line segment of length 0 at position (0, 0).
        Usage:
        GLine gline = new GLine();

      • GLine

        public GLine(double x0,
             double y0)
        Constructs a line segment of length 0 at position (x0, y0).
        Usage:
        GLine gline = new GLine(x0, y0);

      • GLine

        public GLine(double x0,
             double y0,
             double x1,
             double y1)
        Constructs a line segment from its endpoints. The point (x0 , y0) defines the start of the line and the point ( x1, y1) defines the end.
        Parameters:
        x0 - The x-coordinate of the start of the line
        y0 - The y-coordinate of the start of the line
        x1 - The x-coordinate of the end of the line
        y1 - The y-coordinate of the end of the line
        Usage:
        GLine gline = new GLine(x0, y0, x1, y1);

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(double x,
                        double y)
        Checks to see whether a point is inside the object. For the GLine class, containment is defined to mean that the point is within LINE_TOLERANCE pixels of the line.
        Overrides:
        contains in class GObject
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the point being tested
        y - The y-coordinate of the point being tested
        Returns:
        true if the point (x,  y) is inside
        Usage:
        if (gline.contains(x, y)) . . .

      • distanceSquared

        public static double distanceSquared(double x0,
                                     double y0,
                                     double x1,
                                     double y1)
        Returns the square of the distance between (x0,  y0) and (x1, y1).

      • getBounds

        public GRectangle getBounds()
        Returns the bounding box for this object.
        Specified by:
        getBounds in class GObject
        Returns:
        The bounding box for this object
        Usage:
        GRectangle bounds = gline.getBounds();

      • getEndPoint

        public GPoint getEndPoint()
        Returns the end point of the line as a GPoint object.
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the end point of the line
        Usage:
        GPoint pt = gline.getEndPoint();

      • getStartPoint

        public GPoint getStartPoint()
        Returns the coordinates of the initial point in the line. This method is identical to getLocation and exists only to provide symmetry with setStartPoint.
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the origin of the line
        Usage:
        GPoint pt = gline.getStartPoint();

      • intersects

        public static boolean intersects(double x,
                                 double y,
                                 double x0,
                                 double y0,
                                 double x1,
                                 double y1,
                                 double lineWidth)
        Returns whether the given x/y point intersects the line from x0,y0 to x1,y1 of the given width.

      • paint2d

        public void paint2d(Graphics2D g)
        Implements the paint2d operation for this graphical object. This method is not called directly by clients.
        Specified by:
        paint2d in class GObject
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context into which the painting is done
        Noshow:

      • paramString

        public String paramString()
        Returns a string indicating the parameters of this object.
        Overrides:
        paramString in class GObject
        Noshow:

      • scale

        public void scale(double sx,
                  double sy)
        Scales the line on the screen by the scale factors sx and sy. This method changes only the end point of the line, leaving the start of the line fixed.
        Specified by:
        scale in interface GScalable
        Overrides:
        scale in class GObject
        Parameters:
        sx - The factor used to scale all coordinates in the x direction
        sy - The factor used to scale all coordinates in the y direction
        Usage:
        gline.scale(sx, sy);

      • setEndPoint

        public void setEndPoint(double x,
                        double y)
        Sets the end point of the line to the point (x,  y). The origin of the line remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-coordinate of the end point
        y - The new y-coordinate of the end point
        Usage:
        gline.setEndPoint(x, y);

      • setEndPointPolar

        public void setEndPointPolar(double r,
                             double theta)
        Sets the end point of the line using polar coordinates. The origin of the line remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        r - The polar radius length from start point
        theta - The polar angle in degrees
        Usage:
        gline.setEndPointPolar(r, theta);

      • setStartPoint

        public void setStartPoint(double x,
                          double y)
        Sets the initial point in the line to (x,  y), leaving the end point unchanged. This method is therefore different from setLocation, which moves both components of the line segment.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-coordinate of the origin
        y - The new y-coordinate of the origin
        Usage:
        gline.setStartPoint(x, y);
